title: What are the things that stand between you and complete happiness? - Quora

response.answer_text: Happiness has been an interest of mine for many years, as from an early age I was clear that it was my ultimate goal in life. The interesting part comes when one tries to achieve this goal, how on earth can we attain happiness?  As you can imagine, there has been a lot of interest in this in psychology circles and they have come up with some fascinating results.  I'm not going to list reams of research but the main take-aways for me were that happiness does not increase with the acquisition of wealth after a certain level of income, this has been widely reported.  It's also interesting that the way people spend money affects their happiness, spending it on experiences rather than possessions is much more beneficial.  Perception has a huge impact on happiness; being grateful for what you have, being able to recognise positives and concentrate on them instead of dwelling on negatives is important. Thinking other people are better off than you based on completely false assumptions is also very unhelpful, everybody has problems.  Having resilience is also important, knowing that sometimes things can and will go wrong and having the tools to deal with it is massively important, alas many people seriously lack these skills and seem in no hurry to develop them.  Physical resilience is also important, being able to complete difficult physical challenges is hugely rewarding as anybody who has done it will tell you, however, it also imbides the person with an inner strength which can be called upon when needed.  Having loving family and or friends is also very important as it provides a safe base from which to explore the world. All of my happiest memories have been when I have been surrounded by family and friends, and of course it's important to acknowledge this, both to yourself and to your family/friends. Reaching out to people regularly and letting them know how much you mean to them is beneficial to all parties.  In answer to your question, nothing stands in the way of my happiness, I practice what I have learned over the years and it works! We all have bad days but I know they are fleeting. Wishing to be happy all the time is an impossible dream that will never come true.

Following are the things that stand between I and complete happiness . A job with fat pay package with lucrative profileA good looking life partnerA tough muscular body with eight packs absA renowned person10 or 20 luxury carsHuge bungalows in major cities of the worldMillions of followers on social networking sitesand the greed continues ……………… There is nothing stand between I and complete happiness except materialistic way of thinking . It is all mental block . It is nothing but my greedy nature . My happiness is conditional . My definition of happiness is based upon situations and circumstances . If my wishes gets filfilled then I will be happy . My smile is restrictive . It is restricted to certain ambitions .This is what this world is all about . There is nothing called unconditional absolute happiness . We chase after pleasure and call it happiness . This is our belief . This is our acceptance .  We don’t know anything about happiness and the irony is we don’t want to know anything about happiness . The very base of the foundation of humankind is based upon this belief . We don’t know the difference between pleasure and happiness . If I will not get success , I will not be happy . This is the unwritten law of happiness . This is universal truth and no one has the guts to deny this dogma . I can’t think about altruism . If people say I am selfish , then I would love to be called selfish. I can’t be happy just because I live in this beautiful world . I can’t be happy just because I’ve got a precious gift from almighty called life . There are lots of problem exist in this world . Hunger , racism , human-trafficking , child labour , unemployment , violence are regularly running in the news . I am not the victim of any of the above . Still , I am not happy . Certain person don’t enjoy the privileges that I am enjoying , Still I am not happy . I want certain things to be achieved to stay happy . Some call it selfishness and some call it ambition . I really mean it . I genuinely believe what I have written . I really want more and more upvotes to this answer to stay happy . In other words , 1000 upvotes to this answer stand between I and complete happiness .
